result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary L Wertel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gary L Wertel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gary L Wertel was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 18 months if initial confinement.  This includes any time served as condition time.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine in the amount of $2400.00 plus court costs, Pay DNA surcharges; All applicable fees of supervision.
*No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
*If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Provide a DNA sample.
*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

*No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
*No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs.
*Defendant is not allowed in any taverns for 3 years.
*No operating a motor vehicle without a drivers license.

*Cooperate with the Probation Department.
*Grief counseling.
*Referral to mental health assessment.

*AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.
*Random urine screens.
*Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *1 year in the HOC:  the first 60 days served straight, no good time.  The remainder served with Huber for work and to care for his mother

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary L Wertel in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for Ron Dague the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
As to Count 2:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 18 months if initial confinement.  This includes any time served as condition time.

  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 1 year in the HOC:  the first 60 days served straight, no good time.  The remainder served with Huber for work and to care for his mother
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- grief counseling
- referral to mental health assessment
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- absolute sobiety
- defendant is not allowed in any taverns for 3 years
- seek and maintain full time employment
- no operating a motor vehicle without a drivers license
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay fine in the amount of $2400.00 plus court costs
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 years with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 3 years thereafter.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit  Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Attorney Christina E. Balistreri in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court adjourns the 10/15/15 plea and sentencing date due to the reasons stated in the motion that was filed.  Court issues and stays a bench warrant until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Adjourn, received and filed

Defendant Gary L Wertel in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Branch 19 in jury trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary L Wertel in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Gary L Wertel in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Nathaniel Adamson for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/20/15.
